column2: Movement calling for the enactment of §Y$REFORM$§!
Movement calling for the forming of §Y$COUNTRY$§!
Movement calling for the liberation of §Y$COUNTRY$§!
Allows migration between realms that don't have opposing alignments
Movement to allow those of a similar alignment into our realm
External migration only occurs when a pop moves to a realm of their race.
Movement to allow only our race into our realm
There are no restrictions on external migration.
The realm's nobles have high autonomy. They can make almost all decisions without the consent of the central authority.
The realm's nobles have average autonomy. They can make many decisions without the consent of the central authority.
The realm's nobles have little autonomy. Any decisions outside the day-to-day running of their fiefs needs to be run through the central authority.
Almost all armed forces are raised by the nobles. There is no to little of a standing army beyond the household guards and personal retinue of the ruler and his court.
Movement to increase noble levy contribution
Some of the armed forces are raised by the nobles. There is a central standing army which can be supplemented by levies raised by the nobility
Movement to decrease noble levy contribution
Few of the armed forces are raised by the nobles. The central standing army is large enough that levies are not needed for army supplement.
Movement to decrease noble levy contribution
The nobility, in return for their loyalty, are completely excempt from taxes.
Movement to decrease noble tax contribution
The nobility pay a tax, but it is a portion of what the rest of the population pays.
Movement to increase noble tax contribution
There is no special tax reduction for the nobility. They pay the same taxes as the rest of the population.
Movement to increase noble tax contribution
The nobility is allowed to knight anyone they please for any reason. There are no restictions whatsoever.
Movement to increase nobility knighting rights
The nobility is allowed to knight people under specific conditions for a small number of tasks. All other knightings must be given out by the central authority.
Movement to restrict nobility knighting rights
The nobility is not allowed to knight people. All knightings must go through the central authority.
Movement to restrict nobility knighting rights
About 5% of all land in the realm is controlled by the central authority instead of the nobles.
Movement to decrease realm land control
About 10% of all land in the realm is controlled by the central authority instead of the nobles.
Movement to increase realm land control
About 30% of all land in the realm is controlled by the central authority instead of the nobles.
Movement to increase realm land control
About 50% of all land in the realm is controlled by the central authority instead of the nobles.
Movement to increase realm land control
About 70% of all land in the realm is controlled by the central authority instead of the nobles.
Movement to increase realm land control
Nearly all of the land in the realm is controlled by the central authority.
Movement to increase realm land control
Serfdom is enforced. Serfs are bound to the land they work unless they are specifically granted leave or property by their master.\nPoor Pop Promotion Rate: §R1.0%§!

Serfdom is legal but discouraged. The rulers want to bring the realm on the way towards abolishing serfdom, be it because of the aspirations of their own or because of practical reasons. Serfdom appears to be a unliked institution that will mostly be replaced by a system of indentured servitude or through ownership of land by freeholding peasants.\nPoor Pop Promotion Rate: §R0.5%§!

Serfdom is illegal. Those who practice it are punished. Every serf in the realm has been liberated and made a free person, who is not restricted by location and can move elsewhere to improve their chances. How it applies in practice is another matter.
Slavery is allowed. Slaves are used from manual labor to various other tasks as well as grand infrastructure projects.
Only pops that are not primary or accepted cultures are slaves.
Movement to free cultural brethrin from slavery
Slavery is forbidden and punished by law.
No one is allowed to vote.
Only Nobles and Guild Masters may vote.\nNew Government Form: §YMerchant Republic§!
Only well-off people may vote, but the rich men's votes are worth twice as much as middle-class votes.
Only the middle and upper classes may vote.
Everyone is allowed to vote, but the rich men's votes are worth more.\nNew Government Form: §YRepublic§!
Only those of the primary culture can vote.
All primary and accepted cultures can vote.
All people can vote regardless of their culture.
The candidate with the most votes wins.
Movement to change the voting system
The Jefferson Method is a highest averages method for allocating seats.
Movement to change the voting system
The percentage of votes that groups of candidates obtain in elections equals the percentage of seats they receive
Movement to change the voting system
Only members of the ruler's interest group can be appointed to the ruler's advisors.
Movement to change Council of the Realm composition
Aristocrats or guild masters have been assigned advising positions by the leader of the realm.
Movement to change Council of the Realm composition
Council of the Realm is determined by the collected interest groups of the population.
Movement to change Council of the Realm composition
Petty criminals are hanged for their crimes and major offendors are decapitated.
The punishment system is expanded. For serious crimes that do not warrant death, criminals are sentenced to hard labor.
The punishment system is expanded farther. For crimes that are not serious enough to warrant hard labor, criminals are sentenced to prisons for a specific amount of time related to their crime.
Public meetings and rallies are allowed.
Public meetings are allowed during the day. At sundown, they are to disband or have its members arrested.
Movement to allow meetings in the day
Trading rights for specific goods are for specific people only. Usually, these people are the nobles or powerful guilds.
Movement to expand exclusive trading rights
Trading rights for specific goods are for specific people only. This only affects a couple goods rather than most.
Movement to restrict exclusive trading rights
No exclusive trading rights are granted. There are no restrictions on who can trade what.
Movement to abolish exclusive trading rights
Apprentices are determined by a person's bloodline. A son will be his father's apprentice, and the grandson will be the father's.
Movement to make apprenticeships based upon family
Apprentices can either be hereditary or appointed.\nPop Promotion Rate: §G0.2%§!
Movement to allow apprentices to be appointed
Existing guilds have schools in which students can learn their trade. From here, these students can get apprenticeships with guild members.\nPop Promotion Rate: §G0.4%§!

The monopoly on the sale of state supplies, ranging from military goods to the everyday food the court consumes, is held by the cities and the burghers alone with others being at a severe disadvantage when dealing with it. Thus the burghers and various guilds are able to leverage exorbitant prices for their products.
Movement to increase state supply privileges

There are no restrictions on the sale of goods to the state and it is determined only by the demand of such and nothing else. The state employs their own suppliers to guarantee the independence from private enterprises. The monopoly on the sale however is partially transferred to the state as it tries to maintain self-sufficiency.
Movement to decrease state supply privileges
Most of the supplies are still bought from the burghers and the guilds, however it is possible for other sources to sell their products to the state and hindrances to it have been partially removed.
Movement to decrease state supply privileges
Cities are completely independent of the central authority.
Recognized cities are given a charter from the authority.
Cities are incorporated into different territorial regions.
Cities are owned directly by the central authority.
Our town's defenses are nothing more than palisades.
Many of our larger towns now tend to have castles nearby for protection.
Little training occurs. That which does occurs near the home town of recruits.
Centralized training occurs in larger settlements.
We use the same tactics over and over again. If it worked once it will work again!
We come up with new tactics as needed.
Our ports are small and unorganized.
Our ports are larger and well organized
Our ships are of older designs
Our ships are of newer designs
We use the same tactics over and over again. If it worked once it will wor again!
We come up with new tactics as needed.
Our goals are small and focus on ourselves.
Our goals are large and focus on our neighbors.
Teaching occurs in large settlements for the rich.
Our tax collectors are rather corrupt.
Our tax collectors are less corrupt.
Our roads are old and overgrown.
Our roads are new and less overgrown.
Our land and rgos follow time honored traditions.
Our land and rgos use new ideas to increase productivity.
Guilds are starting to gain traction among the upper class.
Traders are able to act and transact without interference from the realm.
The realm reduces taxes as much as possible, even incurring debt if it serves the best interests of the people.
The realm reduces taxes as much as possible, but will not go into debt unless at the utmost need.
The realm reduces taxes as much as possible, but will not go into debt unless at the utmost need.
The realm reduces taxes when possible, but places the economic health of the realm over that of its people.
The realm spares no pity for its people - they are but another resource.
Only the official language of the realm is allowed in public settings.
Minority languages are allowed in public as long as it does not involve matters of realm.
All languages are allowed in every setting.
All languages are allowed in every setting.
Who cares what happens in the outside world? Our realm is great!
The ruler reacts to things that happens outside the realm after news of it arrives. No proactive actions occur.
The ruler reacts to things that happens outside the realm after news of it arrives. No proactive actions occur.
The ruler reacts to intelligence occurring outside the realm, making predictions to the future and acting accordingly.
The ruler will interact with any realm that wishes to interact with it.
The military is the centrepiece of the state and military spending is prioritised.
The government is a strong supporter of the armed services.
The government is a strong supporter of the armed services.
The armed forces are a drain on the state coffers and the government feels money is better spent elsewhere.
The government is actively hostile to the interests of the military, feeling they are opposed to the government policies.
Movement to become a realm aligned against Sauron
We are considered a realm indifferent to Sauron
Movement to become a realm indifferent to Sauron
We are considered a realm aligned with Sauron
Movement to become a realm aligned with Sauron
We are considered a realm aligned with our overlord
Movement to become a realm aligned with our overlord
$PERCENT$% of the voters are part of $IDEOLOGY$\n
$PERCENT$% of our population are part of $IDEOLOGY$\n
We cannot select $PARTY$ as our ruler because:\n
Hold election to appoint a new ruler.\n
$MONARCHTITLE$, we have now changed ruler to
They are a $IDEOLOGY$ interest group and have the following policies.
At least §Y$VAL$%§! is of the same interest group as the ruler.
Less than §Y$VAL$%§! is of the same interest group as the ruler.
It is not possible to switch rules in the middle of an election.
There's currently an election being held in our country. By $DATE$, a new ruler will be elected.
Our government form does not allow us to appoint ruler
Prosperity for the Future with our $TAG_0_1_ADJ$ brothers!' is $TAG_0_0_ADJ$ ruler's newest slogan. Many say this is an indication of a future military alliance.

A new $STRING_0_2$ interest group, the $STRING_0_0$, has been formed in $TAG_0_0$. 'We're currently in the process of recruiting new members and organizing the support structure every modern political unit requires', a party official commented. Uniting disgruntled activists and disillusioned members of other outfits, the new party announced to have scheduled a national convention, where they plan to elect their representatives and agree on the platform. They claim to remain optimistic about ever coming to power despite all odds.

A new $STRING_0_2$ interest group, the $STRING_0_0$, has been formed in $TAG_0_0$. Uniting disgruntled activists and disillusioned members of other outfits, the new party announced to have scheduled a national convention.
A new $STRING_0_2$ interest group, the $STRING_0_0$, has been formed in $TAG_0_0$. They claim to remain optimistic about ever coming to power despite all odds.
There is no active interest group with §Y$IDEOLOGY$§! ideology.
We can not change ruler again before §Y$DATE$§!.
Our form of government does not allow §Y$WHICH$§! rulers.
Slave ideology supporters will vote to follow whatever the realm wants.
Tribal ideology supporters will vote against progress in the realm and active look to reverse it.
Servants supporters will never vote to reform the realm. They only serve our overlord.

We shall be known as an §YUncentralized Realm§!\n
High level technology is only available to centralized nations. By centralizing in the §Ypolitics tab§! you can aquire base technology and start researching on your own instead.

The four realms with the highest rank are §YGreat Powers§! who have the ability to influence and control lesser nations. The next twelve are §YSecondary Powers§! who have the ability to settle unclaimed land, and will challenge the great powers at times. The final two ranks are §Ycentralized§! and §Yuncentralized§! nations, who are rated depending if they are centralized or not.
Become recognized as a centralized realm. This will give us access to the technological advances of our sphere leader
Become recognized as a centralized realm. This will gives us access to the technological advances from around Middle-Earth.
Centralized country, will make §Y$PERCENTAGE$%§! of all resources available on leaders market (Base: §Y$BASE_PERCENTAGE$%§!)
Uncentralized country, will make §Y$PERCENTAGE$%§! of all resources available on leaders market
Second rank country, will make §Y$PERCENTAGE$%§! of all resources available on leaders market (Base: §Y$BASE_PERCENTAGE$%§!)
Centralize to be able to research
We have made no progress towards centralization. We need to enact military or economic reforms to centralize.
This will cost §R$PRESTIGE$§! prestige and give you §R$INFAMY$§! infamy
Removes country from a §YGreat Power§W's Sphere of Influence.

on our soil so we have canceled the Military Access they were so generously given

has canceled the Military Access they have generously been given by us.

Resolving the crisis in this way will give you $VAL$ prestige.

War will break out in §Y$DAYS$§! days if a diplomatic solution is not found.
